```json
  ],

    "The system must demonstrate interoperability with openIMIS or systems based on its framework.",
    "Evidence of alignment with the digital health requirements of specified country governments (e.g., Bangladesh) must be provided."
  ],

}
```

```json
    "A designated group or role is assigned responsibility for managing the update process.",
    "A communication channel is established for the insurance technology community to provide contributions and feedback.",

}
```

```json
}
```

requirement_structuring:REQ-011:bdb8ce8c:
```json
{
  "requirement_id": "REQ-011",
  "category": "Functional",
  "title": "Health Insurance Data Integration",
  "statement": "The system shall be capable of ingesting, processing, and integrating health insurance data to complement other existing health system data sources, such as clinical records or lab results.",
  "priority": "P1",
  "severity": "Major",
  "regulation": [
    {
      "standard": "HIPAA",
      "section": "45 CFR Part 164, Subpart C (Security Rule)"
    },
    {
      "standard": "GDPR",
      "section": "Article 9"
    }
  ],
  "actors": [
    "Admin",
    "Data Analyst"
  ],
  "data_type": [
    "Health Insurance Data",
    "PHI"
  ],
  "action": [
    "Access",
    "Integrate",
    "Process"
  ],
  "acceptance_criteria": [
    "The system provides a mechanism to connect to and ingest data from a specified health insurance data source.",
    "Ingested health insurance data is correctly parsed and stored in a structured format.",
    "The system can successfully link health insurance records to the corresponding patient records within the main health system.",
    "Authorized users can query and view the combined dataset of health system data and complementary insurance data.",
    "All actions involving access and integration of health insurance data are logged in an audit trail."
  ],
  "dependencies": [],
  "traceability": []
}
```

```json
{
  "requirement_id": "REQ-012",

  "title": "Health Insurance Data Integration",
```

```json
{
```

```json
  "statement": "All requirements must be documented in a format that is clear and understandable to both business stakeholders (e.g., health insurance experts) and technical implementers (e.g., software engineers), providing a common platform for specification, prioritization, and system design.",

    "A formal review process is in place for all requirements, requiring sign-off from at least one technical representative and one business representative.",

  ],

}
```

```json
{
  "requirement_id": "REQ-017",
  "category": "Functional",
  "title": "Standardized Requirement Specification Format",
  "statement": "The system's requirements must be defined in a structured format that is understandable to both non-technical domain experts (e.g., health insurance experts) and technical implementation teams (e.g., software engineers). This format must be transferable to software design and implementation, serving as a common platform for specification, prioritization, and compromise.",
  "priority": "P1",
  "severity": "Critical",
  "regulation": [
    "HIPAA",
    "ISO/IEC/IEEE 29148"
  ],
  "actors": [
    "Health Insurance Expert",
    "Software Engineer",
    "System Analyst",
    "Product Manager"
  ],
  "data_type": [
    "Requirement Specifications",
    "System Design Documents"
  ],
  "action": [
    "define",
    "review",
    "prioritize"
  ],
  "acceptance_criteria": [
    "A formal template for requirements is created and approved by both domain and technical stakeholders.",
    "A sample requirement using the template is successfully interpreted and translated into a technical design task by a software engineer.",
    "A domain expert confirms that the sample requirement accurately reflects the business need.",
    "The format supports the inclusion of all fields necessary for prioritization and system design (e.g., priority, severity, dependencies)."
  ],
  "dependencies": [],
  "traceability": []
}
```

```json
{
  "requirement_id": "REQ-023",
  "category": "Compliance",
  "title": "Configurability for Diverse Health Coverage Schemes",
  "statement": "The system must be designed to accommodate and be configurable for a wide range of country-specific health coverage schemes, which vary in design, coverage, and maturity. This includes supporting the different types of requirements needed for each scheme to function appropriately.",
  "priority": "P1",
  "severity": "Major",

    "GDPR",

  ],

    "System Configurator"
  ],

    "Insurance Information",
    "Billing Codes",
    "Coverage Details"
  ],
  "action": [
    "configure",
    "modify",
    "apply_rules"
  ],
  "acceptance_criteria": [
    "The system can be configured to support at least three distinct, representative country health coverage models (e.g., single-payer, multi-payer insurance-based, direct-payment).",
    "An administrator can define and modify country-specific rules, such as coverage limits, co-pay calculations, and eligible services, through a configuration interface without requiring new code deployment.",
    "Configuration changes for one country's rules do not adversely affect the functionality or data for other configured countries."
  ],
  "dependencies": [],
  "traceability": []
}
```

```json
{
  "requirement_id": "REQ-009",
  "category": "Compliance",
  "title": "Health Insurance System Efficacy and Integrity",
  "statement": "The health insurance information system must be designed to ensure timely reimbursements, decrease transaction costs, identify system efficiencies, prevent fraud, and support equitable coverage and treatment for all members.",
  "priority": "P1",
  "severity": "Critical",
  "regulation": [
    "HIPAA Security Rule (45 CFR Part 164 Subpart C)",
    "HIPAA Privacy Rule (45 CFR Part 164 Subpart E)",
    "ACA Section 1557 (Nondiscrimination)",
    "CMS Interoperability and Patient Access final rule"
  ],
  "actors": [
    "Admin",
    "Claims Processor",
    "Compliance Officer",
    "Patient",
    "Clinician"
  ],
  "data_type": [
    "PHI",
    "Claims Data",
    "Policy Information",
    "Reimbursement Data",
    "Provider Data"
  ],
  "action": [
    "access",
    "process",
    "encrypt",
    "audit",
    "analyze"
  ],
  "acceptance_criteria": [
    "The system processes 95% of clean claims for reimbursement within the contractually or legally mandated timeframe (e.g., 30 days).",
    "The system includes an automated fraud detection module that flags suspicious claims based on predefined rules and machine learning models, with a false positive rate below 5%.",
    "A system-generated audit report demonstrates no statistically significant disparities in claim approval/denial rates based on protected demographic characteristics.",
    "The system provides reporting capabilities to track key performance indicators (KPIs) such as average claim processing time and cost-per-transaction.",
    "All PHI and financial data must be encrypted both at rest (AES-256) and in transit (TLS 1.2+)."
  ],
  "dependencies": [],
  "traceability": []
}
```
